noun.description: A form of sexual desire in which gratification is linked to an abnormal degree to a particular object, item of clothing, part of the body, etc.
examples: Victorian men developed fetishes focusing on feet, shoes, and boots

noun.description: An inanimate object worshiped for its supposed magical powers or because it is considered to be inhabited by a spirit.

origin: Early 17th century (originally denoting an object used by the peoples of West Africa as an amulet or charm): from French fétiche, from Portuguese feitiço charm, sorcery (originally an adjective meaning made by art), from Latin facticius (see factitious).
